wikipedia_page.main: Benjamin Hall (29 September 1778 – 31 July 1817) was an industrialist, politician and prominent figure in South Wales.

response: An estate at Abercarn was owned by the ironmaster Richard Crawshay; in 1808, it passed to his son-in-law, the industrialist and politician Benjamin Hall.The History of Parliament: HALL, Benjamin (1778-1817), of Hensol Castle, Glam. http://www.historyofparliamentonline.org/volume/1790-1820/member/hall-benjamin-1778-1817
* Benjamin Hall, 1st Baron Llanover (1802–1867), British civil engineer and politician
* 31 July – Benjamin Hall, Welsh ironmaster and politician (born 1778)
